programme.title: Phantom Ranger
programme.desc: A federal investigator (Tim McCoy) poses as an outlaw to catch a gang of counterfeiters which has kidnapped a government engraver.

programme.title: Brand of the Devil
programme.desc: Tex Wyatt (Dave "Tex" O'Brien), Jim Steel (Jim Newill) and Panhandle Perkins (Guy Wilkerson) are Texas Rangers working undercover to bust up a cattle rustling ring that leaves cards bearing a devilish pitchfork to announce its presence.

programme.title: Hit the Saddle
programme.desc: The Three Mesquiteers (Robert Livingston, Ray Corrigan, Max Terhune) discover a painted horse and a fandango dancer.

programme.title: Broadway to Cheyenne
programme.desc: A New York police officer, shot and wounded by a gangster, travels to Cheyenne, Wyo., to recuperate at his family's ranch, and is surprised to find a bootlegger from New York running a speakeasy there.

programme.title: 'Neath Canadian Skies
programme.desc: A Mountie (Russell Hayden) tracks mine robbers in 1890s Canada.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: Pat and Stoney investigate the closing of a government silver mine.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: The agents travel to Central City to investigate the disappearance of two Postal Inspectors.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Kate decides it is time for Betty Jo to put down the books and set out to find a significant other.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: A pair of crooks plans to rob the Cannonball of its bank shipment.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: After being wrongfully jailed on a murder charge, Cisco and Pancho escape to capture the real murderer.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco is challenged by a man who seeks revenge after being jailed.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: A young woman meets an outlaw; Matt investigates a railroad holdup.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Frankie poses as a gang member's wife but gets caught.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: Miguel inherits a silver mine from his father, but two con men stake a claim on it.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: The judge tries to do a favor for an old friend, but he finds himself involved in a marriage proposal.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Annie (Gail Davis) and Lofty (Brad Johnson) step in when a young cavalry officer (Harry Lauter) is framed for murder.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Lofty (Brad Johnson) faces a moral dilemma when confronted with a notorious outlaw who once saved his life. With Lane Bradford, Bill Henry.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Someone is selling illegal guns to the Indians and the townspeople blame gunsmith Eben Cotten.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Freedom of the press is threatened when the editor is framed for murder.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Adam is taken hostage by a band of U.S. Army prisoners who have escaped and sought refuge on the Ponderosa.

programme.title: New Mexico
programme.desc: After the Civil War, cavalryman Capt. Hunt tries to strike peace with Acoma, a Native American chief. However, Judge Wilcox and others provoke Acoma, arresting him and shooting his men, prompting revenge from the chief.

programme.title: Texas, Brooklyn and Heaven
programme.desc: A would-be playwright (Guy Madison) and a runaway (Diana Lynn) leave Texas and fall in love in New York.

programme.title: Kentucky Rifle
programme.desc: Stranded settlers (Chill Wills, Lance Fuller, Cathy Downs) enter hostile territory with a wagonload of rifles.

programme.title: Kansas Pacific
programme.desc: Southern sympathizers block an Army engineer (Sterling Hayden) building a railway to the West in 1860.

programme.title: Sagebrush Trail
programme.desc: A man is falsely imprisoned on a murder charge, then escapes to join an outlaw gang and unmask the real killer.

programme.title: The Sundowners
programme.desc: Texas brothers (Robert Preston, Robert Sterling) feud over land and cattle, with a younger brother between them.

programme.title: Adventures of Gallant Bess
programme.desc: A rodeo stunt rider (Cameron Mitchell) meets a woman (Audrey Long) who comes between him and his trick horse, Bess.

programme.title: Doomed Caravan
programme.desc: Hopalong Cassidy rides shotgun for a freight company and comes up against a gang of outlaws posing as cavalrymen.

programme.title: The Dude Ranger
programme.desc: An Easterner (George O'Brien) finds rustlers and a sweetheart (Irene Hervey) on the ranch he inherited out West.
